name: Food Vouchers
description: WIC offers food vouchers to moms, dads, foster parents, guardians, pregnant women, grandparents and step-parents who are income-eligible. Open Monday through Friday. Call to verify hours.

name: Food Vouchers
description: WIC offers food vouchers to moms, dads, foster parents, guardians, pregnant women, grandparents and step-parents who are income-eligible. Open Monday through Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

name: Neighborhood Opportunity Center
description: Offers emergency food assistance. Families regardless of residency with limited food resources are invited to visit the Glens Falls Neighborhood Opportunity Center weekly to access food available. Open Monday through Friday from 8 a.m to 4:30 p.m.

name: Neighborhood Opportunity Center
description: Families regardless of residency with limited resources are invited to visit weekly to access the available free clothing. Open Monday through Friday 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

name: Neighborhood Opportunity Center
description: Families regardless of residency with limited resources are invited to visit weekly to access the available free household items. Open Monday through Friday from 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

name: Neighborhood Opportunity Center
description: Offers case management to address issues of education, employment or family functioning. Open Monday through Friday from 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

name: Neighborhood Opportunity Center
description: Offers assistance to families in crisis, when funds are available. Payments made to prevent eviction. Open Monday through Friday from 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

name: Neighborhood Opportunity Center
description: Offers assistance to families in crisis, when funds are available. Payments made to prevent utilities termination. Also, offers furnace testing, repair or replacement, insulation, caulking, weather-stripping and other energy conservation and/or housing repair measures. Residents must be income eligible but do not need to own the home. Open Monday through Friday from 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

name: Food Pantry
organization_name: Family Service Association of Glens Falls
description: Offers food to those in crisis or facing food insecurity by providing three days of food for each person in an eligible family. Open Monday through Thursday 9 a.m. to 3 p.m.

name: Feet First Program
organization_name: Family Service Association of Glens Falls
description: Feet First helps provide eligible children with new shoes for the school year. Applications will be done on the phone from 8/10-8/13 starting at 9 a.m. Appointments for pick-up will be made between 8/17-8/21. Open Monday through Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

name: Advocacy
organization_name: Family Service Association of Glens Falls
description: Offers casework for referrals and networking with other community agencies. Open Monday through Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m

name: Infant Needs Program
organization_name: Family Service Association of Glens Falls
description: Provides supplies for newborns and their mothers who need help with diapers, formula and food. Open Monday through Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

name: Screening for Vision and Hearing
organization_name: Family Service Association of Glens Falls
description: Provides glasses and hearing aids eligibility screenings. Open Monday through Friday 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

name: Emergency Prescription Program

description: Provides assistance in filling emergency RX. Open Monday through Friday 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

name: Rent Assistance
description: Offers rent assistance to help struggling families and individuals make ends meet. Open Monday through Friday from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m., Monday evenings from 6 - 8 p.m., Tuesday evenings from 5 - 8 p.m., Thursday evenings from 4:30 - 8 p.m., and Sundays 9:30 a.m. to 1 p.m.

name: Children's Care Management
description:
Provides help to families by making sure children get appointments with doctors, dentists, mental health providers or specialists.
Available to help whenever needed, 24/7. Open Monday through Friday from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m., Monday evenings from 6 - 8 p.m., Tuesday evenings from 5 - 8 p.m., Thursday evenings from 4:30 - 8 p.m., and Sundays 9:30 a.m. to 1 p.m.

name: Meal
organization_name: Warren Country Office for the Aging
description: Offers meals Monday through Friday to any person 60 years of age or older, regardless of income level or resources. A voluntary contribution of $3 is suggested. Individuals under 60 years of age are welcome as well, but are required to contribute $5. Meal sites are located throughout Warren County. Bolton Landing: Church of St. Sacrament at 4879 Lake Shore Dr. - Chestertown: Town Hall at 6307 State Route 9 - Glens Falls: First Presbyterian Church at 400 Glen St. - Johnsburg: Senior Center at 3548 State Route 28  - Lake Luzerne: Senior Center at 539 Lake Ave. - Queensbury: Cedars Senior Living at 35 Evergreen Ln. and Solomon Heights at 18 Farr East Ln. - Warrensburg: Countryside Adult Home at 353 Schroon River Rd.

name: Emergency Shelter
description: Offers beds to men experiencing homelessness. Also offers a Day Room daily from 9 to 11 a.m. & 1 to 4 p.m. for those experiencing homelessness to come in off the streets, do laundry and access computers. From November to March offers overnight shelter when temperature drops below 32 degrees or 12" or more of snow is in the immediate forecast.
